title: Creamy Italian White Bean Soup Recipe
description: This delicious white bean soup made with creamy white cannellini beans and fresh spinach is flavored with garlic and lemon for a Tuscan favorite.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Beans and Peas Creamy Italian White Bean Soup 4.5 (372) 305 Reviews 29 Photos This hearty white bean soup is made with creamy cannellini beans and flavored with garlic and thyme. It's one of my family's favorite soups. Serve with grated Parmesan cheese. Submitted by colleenlora Updated on March 4, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 29 29 29 29 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1 onion, chopped 1 rib celery, chopped 1 clove garlic, minced 2 (16 ounce) cans white cannellini beans, rinsed and drained 1 (14 ounce) can chicken broth ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper ⅛ teaspoon dried thyme 2 cups water 1 bunch fresh spinach, rinsed and thinly sliced 1 tablespoon lemon juice Directions Heat oil in a large soup pot over medium-low heat. Add onion and celery; cook and stir until tender, about 5 to 8 minutes. Add garlic, and cook for 30 seconds, continually stirring. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in beans, chicken broth, pepper, thyme, and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Use a slotted spoon to remove 2 cups of bean and vegetable mixture from soup; set aside. Blend remaining soup in small batches in a blender at low speed until smooth — it helps to remove the center piece of the blender lid to allow steam to escape. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour blended soup back into pot; stir in reserved beans. Bring soup to a boil, occasionally stirring. Stir in spinach and until spinach is wilted, about 1 minute. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in lemon juice and remove from heat. Serve soup with freshly grated Parmesan cheese on top. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 597 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 245 Calories 5g Fat 38g Carbs 12g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 245 % Daily Value * Total Fat 5g 6% Saturated Fat 1g 3% Cholesterol 2mg 1% Sodium 1014mg 44% Total Carbohydrate 38g 14% Dietary Fiber 11g 40% Total Sugars 2g Protein 12g 24% Vitamin C 28mg 31% Calcium 170mg 13% Iron 6mg 31% Potassium 551mg 12% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Creamy Italian White Bean Soup 01 of 29 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 29 Photo by  Eileen in AR 01/31/2021 This soup has a wow factor that I’ve pretty much narrowed down to the squeeze of fresh lemon at the end. It’s just a belly warming, slightly tangy, filling, delicious soup. I have made it with spinach and also with kale - the kale wins for me because it adds a little more texture. 03 of 29 Photo by  Diane 12/23/2020 I made exactly according to the recipe. Sooooo good. Of course you could make adjustments but this is a great recipe!!! 04 of 29 Photo by  Lcorreia 10/26/2020 05 of 29 Photo by  shelley 04/03/2020 06 of 29 Photo by  Carrie 09/12/2019 I made a few modifications based on other reviewers. I like my bean soup thicker, so I used more beans: 4 cans of great northern beans and 32 oz of chicken broth and then blended 2 cans of beans and added that to the mixture. I also increased the herbs and garlic and added 2 slices of prosciutto as it simmered. And olive oil is a must... not true Italian would use vegetable oil. 07 of 29 Photo by  Carm 11/13/2018 08 of 29 Photo by  Ronnie 11/12/2018 Delicious. I followed others advice on extra garlic and thyme and it was great. 09 of 29 Photo by  Nubian Sistah 07/25/2018 10 of 29 Photo by  Kathy 03/31/2018 Though this was really nice. I used bacon grease and upped the garlic and added red pepper flakes. Used vegetable and chicken stocks/ no water. Put one can of beans in some of liquid and processed that so as to do it while liquid was room temperature. Added purée and rest of liquids , other can of beans and spices and cooked down. Then finished recipe as stated. Easy and very tasty. Definitely will make again but will double next time for sure maybe even triple to have leftovers and freeze some! 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Garbanzo Bean Soup 32 Ratings Easy Chickpea Soup 69 Ratings Bean Soup with Kale 1,040 Ratings Navy Bean Soup 466 Ratings Three Bean Soup 40 Ratings Hearty Bean Soup 8 Ratings 15 Bean Soup 14 Ratings Vegan Split Pea Soup 462 Ratings Split Pea Soup with Tofu 48 Ratings Basic Bean Soup 49 Ratings Luscious Lima Bean Soup 110 Ratings Spicy Slow Cooker Black Bean Soup 539 Ratings Pasta e Fagioli (Pasta and Beans) 552 Ratings Black Bean and Salsa Soup 2,082 Ratings Southern Ham and Brown Beans 265 Ratings Espinacas con Garbanzos (Spinach with Garbanzo Beans) 452 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
